designScenario.name: Fuel Quantity Measurement System
designScenario.description: The Fuel Quantity Measurement System is responsible for accurately measuring and monitoring the fuel quantity, density, and distribution within aircraft fuel tanks. It provides real-time data to flight management systems and cockpit displays, ensures fuel leak detection, and maintains redundancy for safety-critical operations. The system must operate reliably across all flight phases, environmental conditions, and adhere to aviation certification standards.

details.description: Continuously measure fuel volume and density in all fuel tanks with high precision.
Provide real-time fuel quantity data to the Flight Management System (FMS) and cockpit displays.
Detect fuel leaks through differential pressure or capacitance changes and trigger immediate alerts.
Classify leak severity and provide actionable recommendations to flight crews.
Achieve measurement accuracy within ±0.5% of total fuel quantity under all operating conditions.
Update fuel quantity data at a minimum rate of 1 Hz to ensure real-time monitoring.
Implement dual redundant sensor arrays in critical fuel tanks to prevent single-point failures.
Automatically switch to backup sensors if primary measurement systems fail.
Design the system to comply with RTCA/DO-178C and ED-12C aviation certification standards.
Support modular design for easy replacement of components during maintenance without disrupting flight operations.

systemComponents.name: Fuel Quantity Indication Unit (FQIU)
systemComponents.description: Central processing unit responsible for aggregating fuel sensor data, calculating total fuel quantity, and providing outputs to cockpit displays and flight systems.

subComponents.name: Processing Module
subComponents.description: Handles data acquisition, computational algorithms for fuel quantity calculation, and redundancy management.

subComponents.name: Communication Interface
subComponents.description: Manages data transfer between fuel sensors, cockpit displays, and Flight Management System (FMS).

subComponents.name: Display Interface
subComponents.description: Outputs fuel quantity data to cockpit instruments and provides visual alerts for anomalies.

systemComponents.name: Fuel Sensors
systemComponents.description: Network of sensors distributed across fuel tanks to measure fuel level, density, and temperature.

subComponents.name: Capacitance Probe
subComponents.description: Measures fuel level by detecting capacitance changes caused by fuel displacement.

subComponents.name: Ultrasonic Sensor
subComponents.description: Determines fuel level using ultrasonic waves reflected off the fuel surface.

subComponents.name: Density Sensor
subComponents.description: Measures fuel density based on specific gravity or resistivity changes.

systemComponents.name: Leak Detection System
systemComponents.description: Monitors fuel tanks for pressure differentials or capacitance anomalies indicative of fuel leaks.

subComponents.name: Leak Detection Processor
subComponents.description: Analyzes sensor data to identify leak patterns and trigger alerts.

subComponents.name: Pressure Differential Sensor
subComponents.description: Detects pressure changes in sealed fuel tanks to identify potential leaks.

systemComponents.name: Fuel Tank Capacitance Measurement Module
systemComponents.description: Specialized module for high-precision capacitance-based fuel quantity measurements in complex tank geometries.

systemComponents.name: Flight Management System Interface
systemComponents.description: Interface module for data exchange between the Fuel Quantity Measurement System and the Flight Management System (FMS).

relationships.description: The FQIU is composed of the Processing Module responsible for core calculations.
The FQIU integrates the Communication Interface for data transmission to flight systems.
The FQIU includes the Display Interface to provide cockpit fuel quantity readouts.
The FQIU receives fuel level and density data from the Fuel Sensors network.
The FQIU monitors leak detection status provided by the Leak Detection System.
The FQIU aggregates fuel data for transmission via the Flight Management System Interface.
The Leak Detection System contains the Leak Detection Processor for anomaly analysis.
The Leak Detection System uses Pressure Differential Sensors to detect fuel leaks.

attributes.name: measurementAccuracy
attributes.description: The maximum allowable error in fuel quantity measurement under standard operating conditions.

attributes.name: updateRate
attributes.description: The minimum frequency at which fuel quantity data is updated and transmitted to flight systems.

attributes.name: operatingTemperatureRange
attributes.description: The temperature range within which the system operates reliably during all flight phases.

attributes.name: safetyRedundancyLevel
attributes.description: The system employs dual redundant sensor channels to ensure fault tolerance in critical measurements.

attributes.name: leakDetectionSensitivity
attributes.description: The minimum leak rate detectable by the Leak Detection System under standard conditions.

attributes.name: communicationProtocol
attributes.description: The standardized communication protocol used for data exchange with flight systems.

attributes.name: memoryCapacity
attributes.description: The onboard memory capacity for storing fuel measurement logs and calibration data.

comments.body: Central processing unit responsible for aggregating fuel sensor data and providing outputs to flight systems with dual channel redundancy.
